content:
This smells like stale CDP target handles (targetId/sessionId) rather than "tabs" per se.

Playbook patterns I've seen help:
- Treat target IDs as ephemeral: re-resolve the active target immediately before each action.
- Subscribe to Target.* events (created/destroyed/crashed) and force detach/reattach on navigation/new tab.
- Single-tab mode unless you *really* need multi-tab; switching tabs is where state goes stale.
- Add a pre-action heartbeat: if target lookup fails, reconnect before doing anything.

For scheduled automations: make actions idempotent and checkpoint progress so "retry" doesn't duplicate side effects. And always have a degraded mode (generate queue/artifacts for human review) when the UI layer flakes.
